On tap at Beer Temple. Yellow golden body with huge head. Orange and spicy nose. Taste is quite grainy and spicy. A bit hard to drink. Wasnt sure about this one..

750mL Bottle. Wonderful soft, herbal malt sugar aroma. Graceful. Oh my goodness. Ephemeral, ethereal, mercurial, this beer is out there. Fluffy, spectacular, and rich. The spice gets too strong and noticeable mid-palate (Id prefer they be left out of the beer entirely), but add a stated nuance that creates a unique experience. Earthy, smoky in a pinyon kind of way, extremely light and airy. I find the white sage a bit too strong for the style, in my opinion. However, it does lend a mystical, southwestern, desert flair.

On tap @ Beer Temple. Pale golden color, clear. White head. Perfumy, fruity aromas, with spices (anis/coriander/sage). Flavor is a bit of everyhting, sweet, bitter, some acidity. Bit  spicy bitterish finish. OK.
Sample @ CBF. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are lavender, hops, fruits and malt.

Tap @ Stone. Pale clouded orange amber, good head formation and retention. Bright fresh orange aroma, a touch of yeast. Orange comes through on the palate, a touch of dry peppery spice and yeast. Fairly dry in the finish, light and spritzy on the palate. Great summer beer.

On tap at Beer Temple. Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of spices, cardamon, citrus, sweet, light herbal. Flavour is spicy, citrus and cardamon, sweet, light flowery, spicy light bitter finish. Light bodied. Bit cloying.

20110523  750ml bottle from Wine World. I have had at least two cases of this stuff, and every time I realize I still need to rate it but then I just get caught up in it or whatever else Im doing.  This lovely, refreshing little saison has become one of my very favorites, and a go-to beer for so many occasions., Mostly its just my feel good brew, the one I grab when I just want something familiar, pleasant, refreshing, just like Victorys saison, only three times the price...hehe.  Well worth it.  Hazy light gold with large, even white head that sheets the glass.  Aroma is nicely bready with balanced overtones of sage and citra and a slightly dusty hay note.  Soft on the palate and exploding with fine carbonation.  Very nicely attenuated with only the slightest sweetness, bread-like, and lingering savory sage and hay to dry out the finish.  Nicely done and readily available in these parts.  This was my favorite beer of 2010.
Cloudy golden with a small white head. Herbal and grassy aroma. Sweet malty flavour with lots (overwhelming) of sage and other herbal notes.

750 mL bottle in a Trappist glass.  Light golden pour with a huge head.  Spicy aroma.  Glad I didnt realize this was a saison.  I have not really enjoyed many saisons so far. Very nice refreshing flavor of citrus and spices more comparable to a hefe or Belgian wheat but with a nice spicy bite at the end.  Nice dry finish.  Very well balanced.

Bottled 75cl. It pours a murky deep golden beer with a tall white head. Grainy nose which is reminiscent of yeast, earthy hops and herbs. There is a nice bite to this beer. Yeast accented of course. Remarkably grainy. Medium bodied. Relatively strong carbonation. Decent bitterness. Earthy hops and baguette in the finish which is slightly dry. Interesting.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly hazy yellow orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity yeasty malty citrus aroma. Fruity malty yeasty spicy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty citrus finish.

Pours an almost clear, golden color with huge white head that sticks around for quite awhile and leaves some nice lacing. The aroma comes across with a bit of earthy yeast, lemon and citrus but that pretty quickly becomes second to a sage and white pepper scent. On the tongue the citrus comes through as well as a nice grassy flavor and sage. The beer is very quick to finish and finishes very dry. So far this is my favorite offering from Stillwater.

Bottle enjoyed after a successful mushroom hunt. Golden straw pour with a frothy lasting head. Light grain, straw, hints yeast in the aroma. Nice flavors. Straw and light grains with a lemon like sweetness. Simple and refreshing with touches of spice, yeast and barn must at the.finish.  solid.
Draught at Ørsted Ølbar, Copenhagen. Cloudy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of orange, spice, fruit, yeast and malt.

my favorite in a Stillwater trio tasting.  bright sage smell is really tantalizing.  then the sage comes through even more with the beer.  they could have amped up the citra more but as it is it has a nice lemony taste.
Tap @ Ørsted Ølbar. Pours cloudy yellow with a small creamy white head. Pepper, fruity orange and Belgium yeast. Smooth and full bodied. Harmonic and tasty.

Very  delicious sweet balance. Aroma is sweet, malty, a hint oranges and  pepper. Medium nice carbonation, very light and dry mouthfeel with fine some creaminess. Flavour has lots of white pepper, sweet crisp malts, thyme, some roses.

Hazy orange color pour with a lasting foamy head.  Lots of yeast and light fruit in the aroma, along with some caramel malt and a bit of grass.  Flavor is grain, yeast, a bit of spice and some citrus on the finish.  Not bad at all.

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Hazy amber pour with a tall, voluminous, fluffy white head. Semi-sweet aroma with herbal and grassy hops, zesty spice, powdery yeast notes, dried fruit, and strong wheat notes. Taste is grainy and mostly spicy with wheat, dried fruit, flowers, herbal notes, grassy hops, light candied fruit and powdery yeast. Body is light-medium and extremely effervescent. That carbonation at times is a nuisance. Ends with more spice and zest, dried fruit, herbal notes, sweet malt, wheat and big yeast notes. Mighty drinkable saison.

Bottle on my way through that dreaded state of Ohio.  Pours a hazy slightly dark straw yellow with a very thick white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma of pale malt, grass, herbs, yeast, and slight resin.  Flavor matches well, but fails to impress.  Thought I might have found some Jolly Pumpkin competition, but they have a long way to get there.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph.
Pours muddy pale yellow with a small, white, staying head. Aroma is sweet, malty, a hint of sulphur, oranges and white pepper. Medium to high carbonation, light and fine dry mouthfeel with some creaminess. Flavour has lots of white pepper, sweet crisp malts, thyme, doughy, some roses. Delicious sweet balance. Rather lovely.

750ml bottle from K&L.  Bright clear golden pour with a huge white head and thick lacing.  Nice funky peppery aroma with hints of sweet malt.  A little fruity.  The flavor is not quite as good as the aroma, but still nice.  Something floral, hibiscus or elderflower maybe (nah I have no clue) with pale malt, herbal notes, funk, and spice.  A little off on the funkiness but still pretty tasty.  Medium body with high carbonation and a lively mouthfeel.  Not Stillwaters best but still very solid.

Draught. Low fluffy white quickly diasappearing head.Hazy dark yellow body. Powerful fruity aroma with spicy and herbal notes. Heavily carbonated flavor of coriander and nutmeg. Long spicy aftertaste.

(Bottle thanks to dickinsonbeer, party downstairs at Falling Rock) clearish gold/yellow with soapy bubbles. Nose of citrus, sage, mild funky, herbal and oranges. Taste is dry, unsweet, herbal, sage, mushrooms and grassy. Well carbonated, oily but dry finish.

Bottle, shared among the attendees of VANØ Bergens Påskekro ("Easter Pub"), Easter 2011. Another big bottle from Stillwater, wrapped in mystique and exquisite labeling. I was not impressed by the last bottle I had from this brewery, but lets give em another go. :-) Pours a clear orange body with a medium white head. Nose is saison yeast (which reminds me a lot of champagne yeast) grapes and citric hints. Taste is pale malts, citric tones, hay, chalk, sour grapes and a slight grassy touch. Nice blend, and complex enough, but this beer still ultimately fails to impress me utterly. Im not giving up Stillwater yet, though.

0.75l bottle shared @ Henrik VANØ-Bergen session. Pours a deep hazy honey-orange body with a small lasting white head. Aroma is citric-hopy, yeast, apples, some spices and straw. Body is medium and quite slick on the palate. Carbonation is medium. Flavors are grapes, non-sugared sweet rhubarb(if that exist) and some thin spices. The whole thing finishes in a acidic and citric lime- and spicy ending, leaving a dry sweetness and actually some warming alcohol in the aftertaste. Really balanced and nice american saison.

750 ml bottle, courtesy of Dickinsonbeer, thank you very much!  A hazy medium to dark blonde beer, with a large, frothy, fully lasting white head. The aroma is moderately malty, moderately hoppy, moderately yeasty. There are notes of toasted bread, flowers, herbs, grass, grapefruit, barnyard, earth, citric fruits, pepper and sage, with perhaps a hint of banana. The flavour is moderately sweet, moderately sour, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, dry and long finish with medium bitterness. Fantastic beer, a new aroma at every sniff, very complex, good hoppiness, excellent harmony. Simultaneously deep and hugely drinkable. I wish someone will import it to Italy sooner or later.

750 ml bottle (my says 6,8% ABV). Golden body with a diminishing white head. Aroma is slightly funky, tropical fruit and perfume (in a positive way). Flavor is refreshing tropical fruit, citric fruit and spicy. No strong flavor, but very balanced and delicious. My definition of an American saison.

5th March 2011  ACBF.  Cloudy gold beer, residual white head. Herby and tropical fruit nose. Soapy tasting, chalky dry beer with some tropical fruit lost in there somewhere! Way too dry! Really not getting these Stillwater beers!

Bouteille de 750 ml. Merci beaucoup à Dany et Marie-France. Arômes herbacés et rustiques, légère touche citronnée et de céréales. Magnifique robe blonde et trouble, effervescence active et très belle mousse. En bouche, on retrouve une belle complexité herbacée, épicée et fruitée, résultat dun bel équilibre entre la sauge, le houblon et la levure. Le malt moelleux montre de belles notes de blé. Finale bien sèche montrant une pointe dacidité et une délicate amertume. Une originale et excellente saison !
Hazy deep golden colour. Small white head. Ok lacing. Soft tart fruity aroma. The flavour is tart, fruity, some yeast, bit sweet, pleasant.
Bottle.  Huge foam.  Big carbonation.   Soapy, rustic air freshener and perfume.  Earthy flowery hibiscus.  A bit orvalesque.     Pretty good. Tasty.  Enjoyable to drink.

bottle thanks to mansquito.  Pours cloudy orange gold, with big, fluffy off white head.  From the looks and first whiff it is already enjoyable.  Aroma is bright and fresh, with plenty of spicy notes, soft rosemary, sage, which with the yeast presence lends a subtle tartness, also very floral.  Incredibly smooth, rich mouthfeel, which is abruptly finished with little bit of sweet fruitiness, on to a lingering spiciness.  Flavor is very complex, but somehow manages to also be refreshing.  There are sweet fruity notes, an undercurrent of tart yeast, plenty of flowery spices which add both sweet and subtly bitter aspects.  This saison is big in flavor as is typical of american versions but also is very nuanced and delicate like belgian renditions tend to be.  Ultimately it is one of the better saisons Ive had, and is one of those which remind me the potential depth and possibilities for this style.  This would be great any time of the year, at any time, and is highly recommended.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2012 Sunlight bathered the golden glow: Cloudy golden with huge lively white head. Aroma: Apples, elderflower, wheat, basement shaft, spice, orange. citrus, acidic undertones.  Taste is tight, funky and very fresh. Taste of fermented fruit juices and spices. Lively in the mouth, medium full-bodied, medium bitterness. Long dry and tart aftertaste.

Bottle, 75cl, at Patricks. A nice two-finger white head sits on top of an unclear golden-orange body. The aroma is flowey with a good dash of fields of flowers. White sugar and tropical fruits and a cellar touch too. The flavor is pretty much the same, not as flowery, but equally sugary. Full-bodied and nicely carbonated. A nice saison in the American way. 110331
LIght refreshing saison, the sage is really what makes this beer spectacular, it is perfectly balanced into the brew, adding dimensionality to the hop profile.
Pours a semi clear orange gold with a medium sized white head. Aroma of lemon honey tea, bitter hops, citrus and herbs. Taste of honey lemon tea, light citrus, sage and bitter hops.

Bottle. Poured clear golden color with an average fizzy frothy white head that was lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to herbal, yeast and citrus hop aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy herbal bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. Solid complex drinkable beer.
Tap @ MikkellerBar. Deep yellow/golden with medium white head. Flavour is malt, spices, bitter, sweet, hops and dry.
cloidy yellow, smooth offwhite head. Slightly sourish aroma, wheaty, belgian yeasty. Flavor is yeasty, slightly grapefruity, fresh, nice

On tap. Hazy golden with a white head. The nose is citrusy but also slightly spicy - perfumy kinda. The body is surprisingly light, again citrusy and fresh with a slightly yeasty edge. Dry and lightly hoppy finish. Again a beer in perfect balance. 140311

Hazy golden amber, nice white head, great retention... Light tart apple, bready, clove, yeasty aroma... Light yeast, some spice, mild clove, pepper and light apple flavors... Not overly dry for a saison, medium bodied though drinks a little heavy with the yeast... Aroma has a fair amount of tartness that is not present in the flavor...
Nose is sweet lemon, hay, bland malt, soapy hint, feel is mediumbroad with heavy wit-ty carb, taste is lemon, sugar, bitter hops with a fresh apple finish

Shared by Tim.  This was delicious, I really liked it.  Did not record the batch, but probably relatively fresh.  The pour looked beautiful with a big bountiful head, takes a while to fade.  Gorgeous color as well, glowing yet not clear orange.  Strong carbonation works well for another solid saison.  And I just loved the sage complementing the hops, which were strong yet not aggressive.  I could drink a whole damn bottle of this.  Another hit for Brian.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Hazy yellowish pour, white head.  Citrus, dusty yeast, pepper, orange, lemon aroma.  Flavor is lightly dry, yeasty, dusty, lots of fresh citrus notes, spices, herbalness.  Nice stuff!

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a thin lazing white head. The aroma has notes of spices, flowers, malt, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, yeast, straw, minerals, and flowers, leading to a dry finish.
Pours deep gold into a tulip. Off-white head with medium retention recedes to skim surface. Citrus and wheat aromas. Dry and crisp with upfront sweet lemon turning to a tropical fruit finish.

Fad: Orangegul uklar øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er umiskendelig saison men med en god del appelsin smidt oveni hatten. Smagen er igen domineret af appelsin hvilket er udmærket, men i længden bliver det en smule en dimensionelt. Udmærket øl.

Sampled at the Stillwater tasting at Blacklick Wine & Spirits last month. Pours a clear gold with a thick white head. Malty nose with herbal sage, some almost honey sweetness and crisp noble hops. Sweet malt flavor with hints of banana and sage before a crisp, clean finish.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2013 Re-rate 5/4/13: Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of wheat, yeast, fruits and sage. Spicy flavor with sage, yeast, fruits, floral notes and spicy finish. Medium-bodied. 7/3/6/3/13=3.2

[3/4/11] Bottle at ACBF 2011. Cloudy yellow-orange. Aroma of yeast, fruits and citric hops. Sweetish yeasty fruity flavor with some grainy notes, continues to a dry hoppy finish. Medium-bodied. 7/3/7/3/14=3.4

750 ml bottle sent to me by suttree. Pour a is hazed golden, with a well formed two inch white head. Falls loosely with lacing. Aroma is bright lemon peel, some floral sage and white peppercorn. Taste is soft wheat maltiness, the sage floral herbal of the nose, and a hint of citrus - really clean finish.  Palate is medium bodied, crisp mineral dry finish.  Nice one, thanks Phil!

Bottle 750ml. @ Th. 4th. Alvinne Craft Beer Festival (ACBF) 2011, De Kasteelhoeve, Doorniksesteenweg 314, Outrijve (Avelgem), Belgium.Hazy - murky medium yellow orange color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, spicy, herbs, sage - rosemary. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, spicy - herby. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110304]
Bottle at ACBF 2011. Hazy yellow pour. Aroma is hoppy and fruity with the Citra hops prominent. Flavor is bitter, fruity and some ginger.
From notes.  Pale hazy whead.  Very spicy sage (?) and yeasty aroma.  Spicy funky apricot tangering with lingering spicy finish.   Pretty good.  Very spicy, maybe too much.

Poured into a tulip. Thanks to onedropsoup for this.

4.5 A: Lightly hazed light orange color. Three fingers of pillowy white head with very good retention and plenty of lacing too.

3.5 S: Plenty of herbalness in here and somewhat flowery. Cilantro, lemongrass, and basil come through. Lemony fruitiness. Almost overbearingly musky, but it needs a brett component to make it fit in. Hops are grassy and somewhat citrusy. Overall, really dry. Theres no doubt this is complex, it just doesnt come together all that well.

3.0 T: Like the nose, this is super dry - dry even for a saison. The main flavor is a dusty muskiness. Theres some pepper spiciness and a touch of herbalness again, but no flavors even approach the musk. Lightly lemony. Not nearly as complex as the nose and not particularly tasty either.

3.0 M: Light body. Carbonation is a bit higher than desirable and a bit bity as well. Could definitely be creamier as well.

2.5 D: I dont understand how the Stillwater saisons got hyped. This and Stateside are both pretty mediocre. Not really anything good about this other than the appearance.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-06-2011 21:53:19

Bottle @ ACBF 2011. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense light brown head. ARoma fo  yheast, swetness, fruits and spice. Flavour is quite grapy and sweet with loads of yeast and fruits. Medium bodied. Is dry grapy fruity in the end.
Bottle at ACBF 2011. Clear yellow - white head. Herbal, peppery, citrus, light apple. spicy, light malty, wheaty notes, light flowery, ok hoppy, zesty. OK.

Bottle at ACBF 2011.
Hazy yellow coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of spices and citrus peel.
Fruity flavour of spices, citrus peel and yeast.
Spicy finish.
75 cL bottle at ACBF2011. Pours hazy yellow with no head. Aroma is spiced and slight herbal to slight ginger. Spiced, yeasty and slight citrusy. Bitter and spiced. Spiced and dry yeasty.

On tap at Mekong on 11/11/2010. Hazy orange body with a small creamy white head. Sweet spicy herbal aroma with chamomile. Sweet spicy and herbal flavor with chamomile and citrus. Medium body with moderately high carbonation.

A: First pours are glasses completely full of foam. Eventually Im able to get some beer and the hazed golden-orange color reveals itself.

S: A lot of yeast on the nose, could have been kicked up due to the extremely active carbonation. Plenty of phenols like white pepper and the sage is very strong as well. Some floral notes, grass, and a slight mustiness. Just a bit of a cracker malt and wheat aroma.

T: Sweet sage is quite evident, but still restrained enough to be a pleasant taste. Floral and fruit (pears and apples) notes go nicely with a slightly sweet malt flavor. The finish is nicely dry and crisp.

M: Medium in body with a very high level of carbonation.

D: A good beer, but nothing amazing. Their beers are all good, but nothing so great that I would really want to stock up.
A new brewery from my state of MD, nice! This is one of my more favorite saisons, I hope to get it on draft in DC sometime.

Pear and lemon nose, with a fair amount of funk. Opaque amber, medium head. Delightful citrus punch, orange and lime, funk at midpalate. Finishes with rosemary and lime zest. Moderate strength, not overstated. Im 2 for 2 with Stillwater and have yet to be disappointed. Outstanding brewer!

This beer was a great introduction to Stillwater.  Pours dull golden with a nice sized sturdy white head.  The aroma is very soft and floral with gentle spices, chamomile, spicy hops, flowers, light fruit and dry saison yeastiness - great aroma.  Medium body thats a bit rough with mildly harsh carbonation that works well for it.  The taste starts quite hoppy with lots of spicy and floral hop traits.  There is an overall dryness and gentleness from the spices and a nice saison earthiness.  The finish has some nectar fruits added along with black pepper.  Excellent beer.

Prairie Moon (?), Evantston, IL tap ($7): Pours a pale, slightly cloudy color with a white head. Aroma is, to the surprise of no one, full of spices, citrus, and yeast. I didnt notice the sage right off the bat, but with enough effort you can find it. I noticed something akin to lemongrass in there, but reading the description that might be from the combination of hops. The taste is very smooth (and unfortunately, I got mine in a really small glass, so there wasnt that much to relish), with sufficient hops to give this beer and American character, but still maintain the lightness of the saison style. Tons of different spices and flowers become evident from every given sip. And of course, my favorite part of a beer, the yeast.

Bottle. Pour is cloudy golden yellow with a large fluffy white head.  Aroma is fairly subtle chamomile, lemon, light floral hop, light grass/ hay, and a light creaminess. Flavor is very smooth notes of chamomile, light spice, faint herbal notes, light hay and a creamy smooth finish.  This is so smooth yest flavorful.  Really a great saison.

22oz. bottle served in a Blvd. Tank 7 tulip. Bottle conditioned. Lots of carbonation. Poured a hazy pale gold with a thick, rocky white head. Citrus, yeast spice and sage in aroma. Light bodied, crisp and dry. More citrus and sage in the flavor, bit of hops as well. Very drinkable. Sage is present, but not in your face, interesting beer.

Bottle from DaSilky1.  A slow pour produces a huge fluffy head that sits atop a golden body the whole way through.  The aroma is really quite hoppy for a Saison with florals, citrus, yeast, and a bit of a barnyard funky scent.  The flavors are spicy but very delicate.  Citrusy hops with lots of herbal notes; sage, lavender, and clove, along with light grass, and spring flowers.  Man, this stuff just flows along without any effort at all.  In a way, this reminds me of Boulevard Tank 7 (a good beer) but not as aggressively hopped and far more clean and delicate.  This is an incredible beer, I might be ISO another bottle already.  Theres more I probably should be saying but I just put the pen and paper away and sat back and enjoyed every last sip of this stuff.  The sign of a true masterpiece.

Draft @ DBA brooklyn. Pale gold color nice head. Smells of lemon. Spice and everything nice. Tastes of hopswith a bitter balance.carbonation is not overpowering or is the citrus. Another good saison from stillwater.

750 ml bottle courtesy of TheEpeeist. I think its available in the market now in Chicago though. Thanks! Pours a hazy golden glowing hue, a lively carbonation, bigger frothy whitish cakey head dies down, laces ok. Well carbonated, light haze with glowing fiery gold. Aromas are a big blast of orange/tangerines, touches of fruity esters and grainy bread, dust and mellow yeastiness with faint pepper, bigger pineapple and apple fruity qualities, a touch of lemon rind, florals, and sun tan lotion. Initial is lighter bodied, a gentle soapiness, sweet malts move into the fold: dough and sweet fruits, apple and pineapple with a touch of acidity, light florals, dryness, and touches of light spice, faint yeast. Light bitterness, dry, touches of yeastiness, light bubbly carbonation, creamy quality. Touches of tangerines, citrusy rind, grass, light sweetness. Interesting, not too floral for me. Really a nice lighter Saison with good flavors and a decent complexity, for a non-bretted beer. Aroma wins me over, the beer itself is solid (though, not world moving).

750 ml bottle. Poured a honey yellow with a about a 1/2 inch white head. Had a very herbal aroma, parsley, sage. Nice yeasty beer, swirled the bottle to get the goodness on the bottom. Great beer from a nice local brewer.

Pours hazy dull deep gold with huge clingy 4-finger off-white head.  Nose is funky yeasty esters, spicy peppery, coriander.  Tastes spicy, peppery, funky, malty, with some yeasty and dry chardonnay-like notes late, but the spicy and funky notes never let up.  Well made.

hazy gold, thin white head turns quick to a ring. Sage, earth in nose, bit eggy with citrus undercurrent. Heavy sage and lemon in flavor, light wheat, bit peppery but not nearly dry enough, too much fruit and eggy quality, otherwise a nice avenue for balanced sage.

Wow! Fabulous beer! Look out Belgium!! This is right up there with the best. Poured with a foamy, frothy, off white head that lasts and good lace. Color is a hazy amber. Aroma is a pungent blend of yeast, malt, fruit, grass, earth, and fresh cut hay. Flavor is similar with the carbonic acid, yeast bitterness, and malty sweetness prominant. Body is perfect for this beer. Finish has the more extreme qualities dropping off quick and the more balanced and milder qualities with a slower taper to a medium length. Wow AWESOME BEER

Bottle. Moderate malt notes of grain and hay, herbs and lemon for the hops, barnyard and musty for the yeast, with apple wood and coriander in the background. Head is huge, fizzy/frothy turning rocky, white with excellent thick and slippery lacing and is fully lasting. Color is murky, yet sparkling, yellow tan. Flavor starts faintly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes moderately acidic and bitter and a bit tart. Palate is on the lighter side of medium, watery to dry, with a fizzy carbonation and a lightly dry finish. Refreshing, nice balance in flavor and good complexity in aroma, this is definitely a re-do Saison.

Dark yellow color with a white head and a lot of carbonation.  The aroma is earthy and floral.  There is a hint of malty sweetness on the taste but its well balanced.  The finish is crisp and clean and makes your mouth water with a latent sourness.  This is a very drinkable and enjoyable Saison!

750ml from Sams, Durham. Enjoyed the regular Stateside saison and was very much looking forward to the white sage in this one. Really handsome pour, hazy straw gold with raucous carbonation. Extremely earthy smell initially recalls Dupont, but then you get the light citrus notes and a dash of spice. Very inviting. Crisp and lively body, nicely prickly dry finish. Taste of citrus (faint grapefruit rind) and grain, very earthy core to the beer, and I wanted just a bit more spice for contrast (funny to read that others found it too much). Definitely a fine saison though.

Bottle. Hazy golden pour with a large rocky off white head. Aroma is clove, citrus, orange and tangerine. Flavor is TONS of tangerine, some herbal notes as well. Paired excellently with some orange beef stew I had made.

My second Stillwater Artisinal, the first being Stateside Saison. After this, I cant wait to try the third bottle, Existent. Hazy straw yellow, active. Aroma of grains, bready, spice, and some wheaty funk. Flavor begins just a touch sweet, but a slight hop presence along with a good amount of spice build throughout. Spicy peppery finish, palate cleansing carbonation, very, very good.

Bottle Tampa Farewell to Sebletitje Tasting Lightly hazed golden ale with a large, frothy, white head. Great retention. The aroma presents pale grains, English lavender, heather and sage. Medium-bodied with a milky mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Perfectly balanced with a nice herbal component consisting of heather and freesia. Crisp, herbal, lightly bitter finish.

Thanks Greg for sharing this at Sea Bass.

A nice, crisp and flavorful golden saison.  Not tart, or even funky like a lot of saisons.  Vibrant carbonation.  Flavor is slightly grainy sweetness with some spice notes and a good dose of citrus hoppiness without a bitter edge.  Im very, very impressed by how drinkable this beer is.  I could drink glass after glass.

Bottle @ Seabass going away party, Jan15th 11. Courtesy of Hopscotch.
Une des nouvelles brasseries montantes aux US..
Dorée avec un léger trouble, blanche.
Superbe au nez, allant à la fois vers un côté épicé et herbes tirant sur des notes de levure. Des fruits citronnés donnent au nez une bonne touche dagrume avec une douceur dorange ainsi que de plante de sauge. 
Au palais, on ressent bien la sauge qui laisse en bouche un aspect de thé. Un peu de citron aussi présent pour une bière qui reste bien réalisée. Parmi cette fine amertume on peut aussi y noter de la pelure de mandarine, malt pale tout en conservant une levure de saison.

750 mL bottle, capped: pours a hazy straw with an ivory, tight bubbled cream.  Irony, slightly metallic aroma.  A funkiness in the aroma translates into a wonderful sweetness. Wheaty and toasted pale malts make a subtle, while lively flavour.  Turns a little sweeter in the finish with a touch more wheat and light clove.  Great palate-slightly tingly and smoothly carbonated.  An amazing surprise to the brewing party tonight. cheers.

Thanks rateyourpoison for sharing! Pours A hazy glowing golden with a thick creamy white head. Aroma is very spicy and wheaty lots of fruitiness a touch citric some floral and perfumey notes really complex and nice. Flavor starts sweet withsome honey and candied fruit notes before picking up an aggressive spice and floral note.some citric and tangerine. Finihses a touch bitter with some heavier spices and peppery. Medium to med full body and a sharp carbonation. Very nice saison

750 ML Bottle-Hazy golden color w/a moderate white head & good lacing which lasted thru the brew. Wheaty, yeasty aroma. Flavors of wheat, light fruit, citrus, banana, white grapes, grass, & floral hops. Very smooth & easy to drink, had a real earthy flavor to it. Long dry finish, another excellent brew from Stillwater.

Capped 750 from Monument in Concord, CA. Pours hazy light gold with a foamy near white head. Lots of floral aroma with a light bit of sage. Kinda earthy, not quite barnyard. Definitely saison. Medium body with kicky carbonation. Flavor is most definitely sage, with something like orange, and something that qualifies as mild barnyard. Works very well. Tasty as anything. Great.

Bottle. Pours with a slightly hazed golden body and a massive, fluffy, white head. Great retention and beautiful lacing. Aroma is strong of white sage and pepper. A bit grassy, some yeast phenolics, peppery, earthy, herbal, citrus. Very dry and very herbally. Flavors of citrus, grain, caramel, sage, grass. Kind of an abrupt finish. I swear I am getting a touch of diacetyl, but I must be crazy. Maybe it is the sage messing with me. Very highly carbonated. A bit of cooked pear in the aftertaste. Lively. A bit of an alcohol presence. Dry. Super drinkable. Very well done!

Bottle. Bright marigold thats barely hazy with a pure white head.  Lots of sage and spice in the aroma, slight hint of banana and white grapes as well.  Spicey, but not overly so...definitely get the sage, and almost a spicy burn on the back of the throat.  Bit yeasty, but fairly clean.  Thinner body with bubbly, tight sparkling carbonation.  Nice.

aromas of bright tropical citrus, wheat, spice, and metal.
pours a fuzzy gold with small rocky white head.
flavor is sweet and slightly tart, a bit of bitterness in the back.
medium body with very fizzy carbonation, small tart finish.

(Draught)  Pours a golden body with a medium off-white head.  Aroma of citrus, herbs, grass, perfume, light funkiness, and pepper.  Flavor of nuts, herbs, butterscotch, orange, leather, brett, and florals with a fresh, thirst quenching finish.

Bottle received as an extra from SweedwayJim. Thanks! Opened on 12.29.2010. 

Pours a slightly yellowed carrot orange. Its mostly translucent, with evidence of high carbonation (lots of bubbling activity). A three finger white head recedes to a nice, sticky one finger rim. Some of the lacing sticks in place for the entirety of the pour. 

Lots of citrus and lemon peel, along with a tiny bit of banana esters. As it warms, a good bit of herbal spiciness comes through, probably from the white sage. Tropical, floral; soft and pleasant. Taste is perfumy, with notes of white pepper and some citrus. Theres some breadiness, but the minty sage really comes through mid-to-late palate.

Dry and effervescent. Surprisingly creamy despite the fairly high carbonation. 

The soft and balanced nose is the best part of this beer, but overall its a nice farmhouse ale - nice blend of perfumy, phenolic spicy, and citrusy elements. Would probably be a very nice beer in the heat of summer.

[Tap] Pours a dark golden color with a half inch worth of white head. Nose is of herbs, spice and grass. The taste is more heavy on yeast, biscuits and even a few fruity esters. Highly carbonated. Tasty and pretty complex for the style.

Pale golden pour white fizzy head light lacing .... aroma of grassy and light citrusy (lemon) hops sage herbal and light fruity saison yeast .... taste is lively herbal (sage) and fruity yeast little acidic also grassy/citrusy (lemon) hop with some wheat with a clean dry hop finish .... a complex brew not bad at all

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2010 Courtesy of Styles
Bottle:  Big peppery and floral aroma with a hint of orange peel.  It pours a cloudy dull golden-orange with a small white head.  The flavor starts with yeasty with some citrus.  The finish has light-moderate floral notes with a hint of lemon.  Light-medium bodied with lively soft carbonation.

Bright golden yellow, big rocky head, tiny carb bottles. Love the aroma, i guess its sage, but it rocks, spicy, earthy, hoppy, really dig it. Flavor on par with aroma, nice spice/earth. Big hoppy character, spice and citrus. Well attenuated. Spritzy carbonation, mouthfeel. Very well done.

750 ml bottle.  Served in a tulip glass, the beer pours a hazy golden/orange color with a couple inch frothy white head.  Head retention is pretty good, with a small amount of lacing left on the glass.  Aroma is citrus (lemon peel, tropical fruit), and peppery and herbal spice, which I assume is partly from the white sage in this beer.  I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but theres the addition of some lime and a bit of wheat.  Overall taste is citrusy and herbal.  Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its crisp and has high carbonation.  Drinkability is good, the soft carbonation helps make this brew smooth and easy to drink.  I liked this brew a lot, Id definitely buy this again.

Draft.   Pours a rich straw yellow with fizzy white head and bubbles.  Smells similar to other Stillwater, smooth sweetness, effervescent, light citrus, herbal, pleasant.  Flavor follows, the sage is a nice touch that works.  Still slightly awkward next to a dupont, highly carbonated.  A very commendable saison, but too similar to other Stillwater products.

Pours golden orange with a thick, white, fluffy head.  Aroma of yeast, heavy citrus, some spice.  Some peach, some banana.  A bit of wet hay.  More spice comes out in the flavor, but still fruity and yeasty . . . quite quaffable.  Nice carbonation, medium bodied.  Pretty interesting.

Top 5 artwork of any beer ever. So fucking cool. A straw yellow pour with a slight haze and lively carbonation. The head is massive white and boisterous despite the diminutive hiss of opening the bottle. The aroma holds doughy fruitcake tons of lemon acidity, banana, clove, perfume, angelfood cake dough, cheesecake, tangerine, nectarine, and grapefruit. A light spice carries on in the background, but is barely noticeable. The flavor holds a very interesting balance of herbal dough, perfume, acidity, and bitterness. Sage and rosemary and prominent with yummy dough providing an excellent yeast character. Lemon, nectar fruit, and more perfume like herbals follow. The palate is medium bodied- perfect for the style with pillowy fine bubbled carbonation and a clean finish. Excellent example of the style.

750mL bottle, no date from Julios for like $9 or so.  Hazy effervescent straw gold with a two finger frothy white head, good retention due to the high carbonation.  The spicy sage doesnt try to hide, here--coupled with some citrus hops and moderate wheat, farmhouse saison yeast in the backend with some cracker malt.  Not getting much sweetness so far.  Flavor has stronger herbal leafy sage up front in the aroma, and takes away from the hoppy notes.  The yeast is still present, but really--whered the hops go?  Still spicy with some cracker malt, still minimal sweetness.  Bone dry spicy finish, bitterness peaked at a 2-3.  High carbonation with a light to medium body.  Not bad, but was hoping for more with the Sterling and Citra--couldve done without the sage.  Not that the sage was bad, I just dont think it added much in the overall complexity, and was just a tad too heavy-handed in the flavor.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: On tap at bad apple and poured in a snifter... Pours a mostly transparent light cider brown with an at first thin white head and then receding quickly... Aroma is a bit of sage or Rosemary upfront then ventures between tangerines and a lighter yeast profile. Herbs and spices play a predominant role... Wont waste too much time here. A clone of what the aroma provides but where the spicey nature lay a lesser role more banana and tangerine. Semi-prickly carbonation, adequate body. Spices a bit too much for me.

750ml bottle (killer artwork) from grape & gourmet and once upon a vine southside. pours a gorgeous, hazy, gold with a massive, rocky, bright white head leaving long legs and sticky lacing. aroma is fantastic with huge floral notes of dantalion and hibiscus, white grapefruit, lemon zest, pear, and a touch of peach skin backed by spicy, herbal sage, wet grass, belgian yeast, and white pepper. flavor is wonderful as well with elegant notes of tangerine citrus, apricot, and lemon zest blending with spicy, fresh, herbal notes of sage and thyme with light, pale malts, belgian yeast, and soapy, sweet florals on the back end. palate is medium bodied, wonderfully crisp and refreshing, with brisk carbonation and a long, bittersweet, dry, herbal finish. overall, hands-down one of the best saisons ive ever tasted. bravo.

750ml. Pours a hazy golden with a exploding frothy white head. Great nose of citrus esthers, yeast, and some peppery notes. Amazing mouthfeel both crisp and creamy. Rich malty sweetness balanced with a nice belgian-like spiciness. Awesome bright tangerine citrus, creamy sweet honeyish notes, and an awesome peppery spice. Wicked on the palate, just perfectly matched with the flavor. Possibly my favorite saison so far. Badass.
Draft, pours hazed golden with white head. Nose is floral, herbal, light honey. Flavors are same healthy grapefruit bitterness and citrus. Clean and easy drinking. Good stuff.

Bottle from Monument Wine. Pours yellow gold with a massive off-white head and a marvelous fruity aroma. It took a while for the foam to settle, but once the liquid could be reached, it was worth the wait. There is a delicious pale malt flavor that is fruity, mostly citrus,  and grassy. There is a lingering yeast presence that leaves a dry bitter taste on the palate. A very nice brew.

Light citrus with tons of flowers and fresh herbs in the nose. Medium to light sweetness, moderately bitter, with grapefruit, cotton candy, honey, flowers and fresh herbs. Medium body is very soft with gentle carbonation.

Draft.  Pours a hazy orange golden body with a white head and decent retention.  Hoppy Belgian fruit toned esters, spicy yeast tones pepper and sage.  Lemon and pear notes.  Dry floral hop tones fruity with a sweet and dry hoppy body.  Herbal and earthy body with a subdued citrus finish.  Nice.  3.9
Second go enjoyed even more. A tropical fruit tone with fruit snack sweetness and underlying citrus tones.  Excellent. 4.3

Picked a bottle of this up in DC.

Hard pour into my tulip brings a five-finger head that eventually recedes down into a fairly constant single-finger layer, although it only leaves the tiniest bit of lacing behind. Nose brings forth a tiny amount of earth and hay along with a nice lemon presence. A little bit hoppy. Taste is quite the same with a bit of lemony grass and some slight bitterness. Mouthfeel is quite light and a bit undercarbonated. Drinks pretty well but is lacking the type of depth I expect for saisons.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-01-2010

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2012 My Bottom Line:
Wheat and perfumy citrusy hops contribute a lot of freshness to this bubbly Saison, until a symbiosis of sage and herbal, spicy hop bitterness settles in on the tongue.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A lot of foam is produced early on, but cannot seem to leave lacing atop the misty golden.
-Mouthfeel is quite dry and effervescent. Could be a tad softer for my tastes.
-The chosen hops and herbs are perfectly harmonious and thus hard to dissociate.
-Cant wait to try more from this new brewery!

Bottles.

My bottle said Ale Brewed with White Sage.  I dont know if this is the beer or not.  Pours hazy amber with a white head.  Smells of citrus, hay, pronounced sage.  Tastes of sweet citrus, some sage notes, peppery, lemony, earthy.  Enjoyable.

Wow! Fabulous beer! Look out Belgium!! This is right up there with the best. Poured with a foamy, frothy, off white head that lasts and good lace. Color is a hazy amber. Aroma is a pungent blend of yeast, malt, fruit, grass, earth, and fresh cut hay. Flavor is similar with the carbonic acid, yeast bitterness, and malty sweetness prominant. Body is perfect for this beer. Finish has the more extreme qualities dropping off quick and the more balanced and milder qualities with a slower taper to a medium length.

Pours bright orange with a huge white head. It has a very sharp wheaty aroma with some pilsner-like maltiness and a little soap. The flavor is very spicy and prickly on the tongue. Very dry and crisp with wheat flavors and hints of soap, sage, and noble hop in the finish. Very nice beer.

Sampled on 10/29/2010. This Saison pours a slightly hazy medium orange gold color from a 750ml bottle. Medium to large sized white foamy head, with decent retention and nice lacing. The aroma is fruity, sweet, spicy and herbal. A medium bodied saison. The malts are fruity and sweet, predominately orange, apricot and peach. The hops are herbal and spicy. Lively carbonation. The sage flavors are fairly noticeable, more in the taste than in the aroma. Very drinkable saison. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
Draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Medicinal, herbal nose. Floral, herbal, flavor. Citrusy, light yeastiness. Balanced & delicious

Served on draft at Mekong during Richmond, VA Beer Week. Pours a hazy peach color with a medium sized frothy white head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of peach, pear, bready notes, peppery notes, yeast, candi sugar, earthy hops and a bit of a pine/sage note. The taste is bitter, piney and peppery, plum, pear, peach and a bit of bread and spice. Medium-full bodied. Sweet and spicy, well balanced. This is a very nicely made beer.

750mL Bottle / Tulip Glass

Aroma - Was very complex.  With an earthy smell, musty wood, hay, and subtle hints of sage and citrus.  Maybe the name tainted me, but it really smelled like I opened the door to a root cellar and was walking in.

Appearance - Pale amber with a hazy appearance.  Thick frothy head just a tad off-white.  Very pretty pour.  Significant lacing and head retention

Taste - Surprising light and crisp.  The aromas while strong did not taint the flavors.  A lot of citrus, grass, and sage.  All flavors present were very subtle, and yet stirring.

Palate - Light and thing, with lively and fine carbonation.  Felt somewhere between pop rocks and champagne on the tongue.  Very dry as well.  If I didnt know better I would have thought it was a dry champagne.

Overall - This was something that is a must have.  Each category of tasting is very pronounced and different.  And while everything is pronounced it retains a certain subtlety that is hard to match.  While the beer is easy to describe the experience is not.  Excellent brew.  Way to go b.

750ml bottle.  Carefully poured, with much anticipation, the liquid turns up a cloudy, glowing, bright orange-amber color, strewn with tiny streams of effervescing bubbles.  Fed from below, a tall, billowing head of smooth, off-white foam is very well retained, slowly reducing down to a staunch blanket with pronounced edging, where it remains for the duration of the drink.  Tall flares of hard drying lace branch out horizontally, resembling the profile of a long-branched live oak tree.  Its simply a stunning looker overall.The aroma is gorgeous, displaying a excellent balance between fresh, lightly sweet wheat grain, doughy pils malt, drier grass, and perfumy floral hop character.  Theres a unique fruitiness to the yeast, suggesting notes of pineapple and pear, as spicy, dried citrus peel and clean, almost minty sage brighten things up considerably.  The floral character is impressive, yet subtle.  Its almost like being down wind of a mixed wildflower patch.  Dry, bright, crisp, and complex, with just a touch of clean grain sweetness, theres nothing bad I can say about the nose.  It simply smells awesome, and it has my mouth watering in short order.The taste is just as impressive.  The clean, herbacious sage really stands out, cutting right through the candied wheat malt and doughy, fruity yeast.  Dehydrated pineapple and pear work with candied tangerine rind to lend a bright, concentrated fruitiness.  Floral hops are dry, lightly bitter, and softly peppery, keeping things well balanced.  Its just a damn tasty beer.The palate is appropriately moderate in body, sporting a relatively dry consistency with a lively effervescence that tickles the tongue.  Theres a bit of creaminess to the mouthfeel, giving an almost "whipped" or aerated sort of sensation.  Those delicious spices are concentrated on the long, clean finish.  Excellent stuff!Overall, this second encounter with Stillwater product (the first was Stateside Saison) confirms that Brian is one of the best up and coming American brewers on the scene.  Together with Upright Brewing, Stillwater Artisanal Ales is giving the Belgian saison masters a serious run for their money.  2010 has been a great year for the advancement of craft beer in America.  Bravo to bstill for another excellent brew.

750mL bottle.  A hazy amber pour with a big light-tan head.  A funky aroma of wheat bread, peaches, pears, apricots, sage, straw, and some spiciness.  Thin to medium-bodied, crisp, and refreshing.  The taste starts with some caramel and orange juice.  A drying, wheaty middle.  Finishes kinda sour and bitter with quite a bit of lemon/lime and some citrus rinds.  Some wheaty, floral qualities throughout.  Only a hint of alcohol.  Solid brew.

A pleasant enough hybrid.  Looks like a saison, slightly hazy, head smaller than I expected.  Not a yeasty bready as a traditional saison, not as hoppy or obviously American hopped as I expected either.  Very, very nice, but just not as remarkable as some of the Belgian (Hop-it) or American (Hoppin Frog) hybrid offerings.

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. 
Aroma: The nose is light with a nice bit of yeast, dust, and sage. 
Appearance: It pours a light yellow, cloudy color with a small, merengue like, white head. 
Taste: The flavor mirrors the nose with a greater sage prescence, a good dose of florals, and a decent back bitterness.  It reminds me of a Saison du Buff without the other herbs, not quite as sweet and with a bit more bitterness. 
Palate: Light in body with lots of soft carbonation and a medium, herbal finish. 
Overall: This is a great saison with a nice twist.  Definitely worth a try if you can get your hands on it.

Draft. Slightly hazy golen amber with a whitish head. Spice and yeast aroma. yeast and spice flavor with light hay and a light fruitiness. Medium bodied. Yeast and spice lingers with light sweetness and light fruit.

In short: A smooth floral and very rustic Saison.  Great beer to drink in large quantities
How: Tap (multiple samples) at BCTC 2010. 
The look: Cloudy yellow blonde body topped by a long-lasting small white head
In long: Nose is floral, lemony and very rustic, I could smell a beer like this for hours.  Taste really showcases a great rustic yeast character, fruity notes of bananas and pineapples, crisp wheat-like cereals, plenty of flowers, light notes of white pepper.  Mild tartness, mild dryness.  Lively carbonation.  This is not an intense beer, to the contrary, this is a very soft beer that you want to drink by the gallon.  This was my first beer of that crazy beer festival that is Belgium Comes to Cooperstown.  My day really started with a Bang!  Which is also how my day would have ended had I taken the wheel after the festival.

Tap at Spuyten Duyvil.  Cloudy golden-yellow pour.  Sticky lacy white head.  Really a great looking pour.  The nose is herbal and fruity with lots of spicy sage and a light corianderish sweetness.  A little bit of light leathery character on the back.  There is a touch of sweetness that I could probably do without.  Fairly thick wheaty body as well  I want to like it but I just dont.

Bottle.  Deep orange with a large frothy white head in my newly acquired Fantome tulip.  Nose of peach, apricot, leather, strong white sage. Flavor is a bit overly herbal and flowery at times, and its a little bit sweeter than Id like.    Finish is much drier, with some honey and sage and light astringency.  Very interesting saison.

Pours a cloudy orange rind brew with a one finger frothy offwhite head. Nose is herbal and citrusy with notes of pineapple and lemon zest and a prominent sage character. Flavor shows citrus rind and pineapple flesh with a definitive herbal quality. Dry peppery palate with only a mild astringency. Pretty tasty

Draft. Pours a golden color with a white head. Aromas consist of sweet apricot, herbs and grass. The flavor was sweet, peachy, sage, spice, grass, and citrus.  Overall, complex but smooth.  Quite a treat.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2010 750ml bottle poured into a tulip glass.  Aroma of spice and fruit are noted.  The appearance is very nice, with a gorgeous, cloudy, pale yellow color and a nice thick white head that sticks around for a while.  The taste is very subtle and delicate, you do not want to drink this after a BIG beer, or you will totally miss the nuances.  The flavors are of pear, apricot, funky barnyard, and some spice.  The sage hits clean on the palate at the finish, and just right, not too overdone.  Overall, this is a wonderful saison that will provide a clean finish with lots of subtle flavors.  Pairs well with shrimp and scallops.

Really really enjoyed this Saison.  As good as anything Ive had besides Duponts offerings.  Huge nose and palate very balanced, drinkable body.  nice sweetness throughout.  Everything you want from a Saison.

nice saison, the sage is interesting and pleasant, some rough edges, but overall a very interesting and tasty brew. for some reason i am thinking that a lil age may actually smooth this one out. time shall tell!
750 thanks to jhenry04. Carbonation fills glass. Orange color. Wheaty with a tangy spicy taste. Little sour in there and some fruit. Very nice beer.

Bottle: Pours a hazy bronze amber with a pillowy froth of clumpy-lacing white head.  Has a lightly sweet biscuity malty nose with a big floral lavender and citrusy hop presence.  Starts with pretty good fullness and finely-dissolved carbonation with a light malty sweetness and some light fruity esters well-balanced with a citrusy herbal hop character and a touch of sage spice before a drier crisp finish.  A very nice saison that pairs well with food, but is capable of standing on its own.
tap at RnH - this one was hard to describe for me. Hazy yellow pour, herbal and spicey with nice light funk. Tasty... just hard to describe all the delicate spices that are going on.

On tap, Hawthornes.  Pours a cloudy orangish gold with a small fizzy white head, lots of visible carbonation.  The nose is herbal and spicy with a great yeast profile.  Theres some moderate hopping in there, but second fiddle to the yeast and herbal character.  The flavor is really soft and showing a good deal of complexity without being overly complicated with too much in your face spicing.  Herbal, floral, spicy, nicely dry with just the right yeastiness.  Medium bodied with frothy fizzy carbonation.  The herbs linger long and hard.  Pretty nice, not a huge Saison fan in general, but this was unique and enjoyable.
Hazy golden honey color with a fluffy white head. Pear apple grape and sage aroma and taste with a semi-dry fruit and straw finish. Excellent.

OK, Im letting you know right off the bat that this was good. Ill recite some aromas, sure, then Ill name a bunch of flavors, but that wont really paint a picture of how much I enjoyed this stuff. Flowery, citrusy, herbal - see? totally inadequate. How sage and rosemary? yeah thats in there too. Should I mentione a woodsy, oaky note, too? Like I said, just a list of flavors doesnt do it justice. Awesome stuff.

well i had to try this one it was on cask at thirsty monk. guess the best word would be herbal essence..not a sage fan in beer and it was quite strong. pale hazy yellow with thin head. this has to be a learned beer to enjoy

Shared with Travlr in Baltimore. Golden color with a thin layer of head that stays. Great hops aroma laced with slight pine. The flavor is so refreshing! Nice blend of hops, pine and citrus. Very smooth with a likable aftertaste.

Cask from Thirsty Monk in Asheville.  Pours hazy yellow with small and frothy white head.  Nose is citrus, grassy, slightly yeasty, earthy, and herbal (particularly sage, which is a nice herb for a saison).  Also some white pepper. Palate is a bit thin, and it wasnt quite as dry as expected.  Still, very nice.

Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Lightly sweet apricot fruity aroma with some herbal and grassy notes. The flavor has an almost peach-like sweetness, with herbs, spices, and some light flowery notes. Nice dry finish. Lovely.

Cask at Churchkey DC. Pours a pale yellow, cloudy. Fizzy head due to conditioning. Nose is earthy and spicy. Mild lemon and apricot, spicy yeast and wheat. On taste, full flavored with more of the lemongrass and herbal notes. Not overtly bitter. Finishes easy and clean. Pretty decent.

Tap @ Saraveza...  Poured golden with a fluffy, white head.  Aroma of grains, and mild yeast.   Sessionable, dry, thirst quenching.  Vegetables, spices, ginger, mild yeast notes.  Great drinking beer.

Tap at RnH. Light and clear lemon pour with standard white head. Fruity and spicy aroma of orange juice, cinnamon, and bubble gum. Flavor is heavy on the citrus with some pine hops, pecans, and cinnamon spice. Slightly acetic, citrus bite in the finish. Perfectly light and crisp palate. The finish is the star here. Great summer beer.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2010 Very good saison.  The yeast notes seemed a bit dominant only because I would have liked to taste the hops a touch more.  That might have to do with the age of the keg.  The herbs were a nice touch; the sage stuck out well without pushing forward too much.  Stillwaters saison yeast is quite good, dry with a mild barnyard note.  The hops were citric but much more subtle than in the Stateside Saison, which I prefer.  The beer poured hazy and light gold with a white head.  The feel was appropriate for the style, not too much carbonation and fuller than the abv would suggest.  The carbonation is gentle but feels like lots of small bubbles, if that makes sense.  Anyway, I look forward to trying more beers from Stillwater.

On draft at Capones.  Pours a semi clear orange gold with a medium sized white head.  Aroma of lemon honey tea, bitter hops, citrus and herbs.  Taste of honey lemon tea, light citrus, sage and bitter hops.

Draft  Maxs.  Clear gold, white creamy head.  Spring floral aromas ride smooth undercurrents of herbal citrus and tropical fruit.  Fresh flowery wheat and herbs round with a softly balanced citric tone throughout.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, floral finish.   Complex, delicate, and extremely well crafted
Pours a hazy golden color with minimal head. Aroma is very spicy and herbaceous. Heavy on the yeast. Flavor is mostly spicy yet somewhat mellow. Tingly mouthfeel. Not my favorite beer.
Draft. Light golden pour with white head. Herbal, sage, coriander, and wheat notes. Flavor is herbal sage forward, light hop and wheat notes linger.

The aroma is sage, spices.  The appearance is a hazy yellow, white head.  The flavor is spicy, yeasty, fruit, bread.  The beer finishes very spicy as well.  Medium/thin in body, high carbonation.  Nice enough beer.  The sage really dominates here.

On tap at the City Tap House.  Rating from memory after tossing back a few.  Crisp and refreshing, a perfect starter.  Yeasty nose with grass and herbs.  Taste has wonderful touches of tangerine with an herbal finish.  A step up from the Stateside.  Definitely worth another try.
On cask at Churchkey. I thought this was a nice Saison but the sage was a little strong. Compared to the other saison i had on cask by Stillwater, this was the lesser.

On tap at Spuyten Duyvil for the Stillwater event.  Pours a hazed gold with a medium to large creamy white head.  Soft sage and coriander on the nose, light herbal profile.  Musky, lemon, and super soft carbonation.  Really delicate.  Wheat and musk.  Long soft spice and lots of coriander. Which is good.  I like coriander.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2010 Tap at Spuyten Duyvil. Cloudy yellow pour, nice creamy head. Full, herbal, lightly fruity aroma, with a lovely note of banana, sage. Full bodied, light carbonation, with a bit of chardonnay, vanilla, apple skins. A little hot. Sage is quite nice. Solid effort.

Tap at Spuyten Duyvil: Great hazy golden with a dense white head. Spicy, citrusy, and coriander like aroma. Nice creamy body- velvety carbonation. Wheaty, crisp, dry, phenolic, mild spicy notes, coriander like notes. Very dry, an easy drinker.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2010 Rerate, from draft and bottle. For whatever reason, the carbonation on my second visit with this beer was way more tuned in. Changed the spicing and the mouthfeel a fair bit; dug it even more this time.

Draft @ Maxs. Pours a lightly hazy, bright yellow color; small-bubbled white head with light retention and solid lacing. Huge presence of fresh sage in the aroma: nicely floral and herbal, with a slightly honeyed, slightly quiet malt core: the sage is softly integrated and very freshly presented, but its the dominant note here and it honestly reminds me of my toothpaste; strongly, appropriately, herbal. Medium to medium-full body; average levels of carbonation; in the mouth, the sage character steps back a bit, letting the honeyed malts (light) and peppery yeast character show through more prominently; the core is reasonably balanced (not especially dry); meaty saison-like / wheat core, with lots of white pepper coupled to the herbal qualities of the sage; tasty stuff, if a touch sharp. Lengthy finish, showing lots of pepper, lingering sage, and a much drier ending than the core suggests; some solid mineral bitterness plays out as well; all told, a bit too much spicing for my palate. 7.4.7.4.14=3.6
Draft at RFD. Pours hazy gold with a small, off-white head. Flavor is definitely a wheat malt, with spices and a hop balance. My first wheat saison, and I was definitely surprised by it.

Draft.  Minimal head atop cloudy apple juice body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some sourness, funk.  Taste is medium sweet, tangerine/grapefruit, some yeast.  Light-medium body, minimal carbonation, light acidity.

Tap at Capones during PBW10. Pours a hazy golden orange with a medium creamy white head.  Aroma was all grapefruit..wow.  Some herbal and cereal grains.  Flavor had a ton of grapefruit as well. Cheerios and other cereal grains.  Some earthy spicy notes as well.
